page.title: 06ROSSINGTON MINER'S MEMORIES
page.content: When the Rossington Pit opened many experienced miners were needed. They came from other established mining areas such as the South Wales, North Wales, Nottinghamshire, Durham and Scottish Coalfields. Mr E.S. Jones now aged 85 was one of these men. He worked at Rossington Colliery for 43 years. He was born in Wrexham, N.E.Wales. He left school at 14 and got a job at the local pit earning 1s-6d (7\p) a day. He started work on the coal face when he was 16 years old and can remember filling his tub with "large lumps and no dirt". He also had a pit pony to look after. Mr Jones came to Rossington in 1922 because he could earn 2 shillings a shift more. In his 43 years at Rossington he saw the development of the pit from pure manual labour to its present day high mechanisation.
